alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Butler; Clarion; Forest; Venango (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 12:08AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT VENANGO...NORTHEASTERN BUTLER... NORTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG...NORTHWESTERN CLARION AND WEST CENTRAL FOREST COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1207 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Franklin, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oil City, Franklin, Knox, Sugarcreek, Tionesta, Hasson Heights, Seneca, Sligo, Emlenton, Rouseville, Clintonville, Shippenville, Cooperstown, St. Petersburg, Eau Claire, Kennerdell, Callensburg, Woodland Heights, Foxburg, and Fryburg. This includes Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 33 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for northwestern Pennsylvania.
